chapter.title: Select & Acquire Admin Maintenance E-Docs

para.emphasis: > Select and Acquire Admin Links

chapter.para: Order, Paying, Receiving, and E-Resource maintenance e-docs as well as general ledger entry and available balances lookups are available via the Select/Acquire Admin submenu on the Maintenance menu.

section.title: Bank

para.emphasis:
> Bank
> Bank Lookup
> Bank

section.para: Even though a library's acquisition process does not require that the library actually do their own banking, at least one bank record is required to process invoices. Banks are also used to identify institutions to which deposits are made on Advance Deposit and Cash Management documents. In the PDP, they are used to identify institutions from which disbursements are made. This functionality was an inheritance from KFS and requires future refactoring.
The Bank document allows you to view and edit bank information currently in OLE, including the bank's routing number and account number. Using this screen, you may also add new banks to the system.
When the Flexible Banking Enhancement is in use, additional document types may require users to identify a bank.
Only users with the OLE-SYS Manager role may create Bank maintenance documents. These documents do not route for approval.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Bank document includes the Edit Bank tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Bank tab definition

entry.para: A unique ID number that identifies this bank in OLE.
Required. The name of the bank associated with this code.
Required. An abbreviated name for the bank (up to 12 characters allowed).
The routing number associated with this bank.
Required. The bank account number from which disbursements are to be drawn or deposits made.
A text description for this bank account.

Optional. If using the Flexible Banking Enhancement, this is the Chart of Accounts code associated with the account to which cash offsets should post when OLE transactions are associated with this bank. Existing chart codes may be retrieved from the lookup
.

Optional. If using the Flexible Banking Enhancement, this is the account number to which cash offsets should post when transactions are associated with this bank. Existing accounts may be retrieved from the lookup
.

Optional. If using the Flexible Banking Enhancement, this is the number of the sub-account to which cash offsets should post when transactions are associated with this bank. Existing sub-accounts may be retrieved from the lookup
.

Optional. If using the Flexible Banking Enhancement, this is the object code that should be used for cash offsets that post when transactions are associated with this bank. Existing object codes may be retrieved from the lookup
.

Optional. If using the Flexible Banking Enhancement, this is the sub-object code that should be used for cash offsets that post when transactions are associated with this bank. Existing sub-object codes may be retrieved from the lookup
.

Optional. A bank code to be used in place of an inactive bank code. Existing bank codes may be retrieved from the lookup
.
If OLE attempts to reference a Bank record that has an inactive bank code, the system uses bank information associated with the specified continuation bank code instead.
Checked box indicates that this bank will be used for deposits.

note.para: Note that a bank may be used for both deposits and disbursements.

entry.para: Checked box indicates that this bank will be used for disbursements.

note.para: Note that a bank can be used for both deposits and disbursements.

entry.para: Checked box indicates that this bank will be used for ACH disbursements in the PDP.

note.para: Note that a bank can be used for both ACH deposits and checks.

entry.para: Checked box indicates that this bank will be used for check disbursements in the PDP.

note.para: Note that a bank can be used for both ACH deposits and checks.

entry.para: Indicates whether this bank code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

section.title: Implementation Information
section.para: There’s a parameter called “Default_Bank_By_Document_Type” which sets a default Bank for each document type. Make sure the bank values you have in this parameter actually exist in the FP_BANK_T table (the bank maintenance document). A default bank is provided with the bootstrap data. If you create a new default bank, the parameter values must match it.

The value for the Default_Bank_By_Document_Type parameter in OLE's demo system is OLE_DV=TEST;OLE_ND=TEST;OLE_AD=TEST;OLE_CMD=TEST;OLE_PREQ=TEST;OLE_PRQS=TEST;OLE_CM=TEST;OLE_CTRL=TEST;OLE_CCR=TEST. The syntax for the value is “doctype=bank;” These values will not appear on the Invoice document, since its Bank Code field is an input box, but they do work within the code. Without the bank and the Default_Bank_By_Document_Type parameter correctly implemented, you will receive the message "Bank Code is a required field" when you create an Invoice.

section.title: Billing Address Billing Address document

para.emphasis:
> Billing Address
> Billing Address Lookup
> Billing Address

section.para: The Billing Address document defines the various addresses to which vendors should send invoices. Addresses are specific to a campus.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Billing Address document includes the Edit Billing Address tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Billing Address tab definition

entry.para: The campus code associated with this billing address.
Required. The familiar title of the billing address.
Required. The first line of the address information for this billing address.
Optional. The second line of the address information for this billing address.
Required. The city name associated with this billing address.
The state associated with this billing address. Existing state codes may be retrieved from the list.
The postal code associated with this billing address.
Required. The country associated with this billing address. Existing country codes may be retrieved from the list.
Required. The phone number, including area code for this billing address. (Formatted: xxx-xxx-xxxx)
Indicates whether this billing address is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

section.title: Building

para.emphasis:
> Building
> Building Lookup
> Building

section.para: The Building document defines a unique identifier, a building location, and an alternate code for a building. The code is used to identify where library items should be delivered.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Building document includes the Edit Building tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Building tab definition

entry.para: The campus code associated with this building.
Unique identifying code for a building.
Required. Familiar name for the building associated with this building code.
Required. Specific street address of the building associated with this building code.
Required. The city name associated with this building.
The state associated with this building. Existing state codes may be retrieved from the list.
The postal code associated with this building.
Required. The country associated with this building. Existing country codes may be retrieved from the list.
Optional. An alternate identifier for the building.
Indicates whether this building is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

section.title: Cancellation Reason

para.emphasis:
> Cancellation Reason
> Cancellation Reason Lookup
> Cancellation Reason

section.para: When voiding a Purchase Order, the operator is presented with two fields to explain the reason for the cancellation. One of them is an optional free-text field, in which they can type whatever they want. The other is a required choice from a drop-down list, controlled by the Cancellation Reason maintenance document. Both notes are retained in the PO after cancellation, and also passed to the relevant item record in Docstore.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Cancellation Reason document includes the Add/Edit Cancellation Reason tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Add/Edit Cancellation Reason tab definition

entry.para: Required. The name of the reason for the cancellation.
Required. A description for the cancellation reason.
Indicates whether this cancellation reason is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

section.title: Carrier Carrier document

para.emphasis:
> Carrier
> Carrier Lookup
> Carrier

section.para: The Carrier document defines the possible freight carriers and shipping companies assigned to deliver goods.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Carrier document includes the Edit Carrier tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Carrier tab definition

entry.para: A unique code to identify a particular carrier.
Required. A description or name of the carrier.
Indicates whether this carrier code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate the code.

section.title: Currency Type

para.emphasis:
> Currency Type
> Currency Type Lookup
> Currency Type

section.para: Currency Types allow for requisitions, purchase orders and invoices presented for payment in currencies other than the base currency to be processed and paid. It defines and triggers amounts to be changes to the base currency for vendors billing in a foreign currency. Currency Type is defined for each vendor on the Vendor tab, in the Detail Information section.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Currency Type document includes the Edit Currency Type tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Currency Type tab definition

entry.para: Required. The type of currency (i.e. US Dollar)
Required. The name of the country that uses the currency.
Required. The abbreviation of the Currency (i.e. USD)
Required. This is an International Standards Organization (ISO) numeric code assigned to each currency.
Required. The number of ‘sub’ units (i.e. there are two positions for cents when using USD)
Indicates whether this currency type is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

section.title: Delivery Required Date Reason Delivery Required Date Reason document

para.emphasis:
> Delivery Required Date Reason
> Delivery Required Date Reason Lookup
> Delivery Required Date Reason

section.para: The Delivery Required Date Reason document defines the reasons for requiring the delivery date in the Purchasing/AP module. Examples might include types of 'Must Receive' or 'Estimated Date.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Delivery Required Date Reason document includes the Edit Delivery Required Date Reason tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Delivery Required Date Reason tab definition

entry.para: The code to identify this delivery required date reason from the Reason Code list.
Required. The familiar title for this delivery required date reason.
Indicates whether this delivery required date reason code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate this code.

section.title: Donor

para.emphasis:
> Donor
> Donor Lookup
> Donor

section.para: Donor codes allow for recognition of a donor. A donor could be:

listitem.para: someone who has given money or materials to the library
someone on whose behalf others have given money or materials
someone the library wants to honor, regardless of a gift

section.para: on a purchase order line item, a Docstore item record, or both. Donors are an optional data element for both POs and Docstore items.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Donor document includes the Add/Edit Donor tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Add/Edit tab definition

entry.para: Required. A 10-character alias for this donor.
Required. The common name by which library staff know this donor.
Optional. Additional information for staff about this donor.
Optional. Text to send to discovery layers for items associated with this donor.
Optional. Amount of money given by or on behalf of this donor this fiscal year.
Optional. The web address of an image file, which serves as the virtual "bookplate" for items associated with this donor code.
Optional. A URL for a public web page for this donor.
Indicates whether this donor is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

section.title: Exception Type

para.emphasis:
> Exception Type
> Exception Type Lookup
> Exception Type Document

section.para: The Exception Type identifies types of exceptions when receiving resources. Some exceptions are received damaged, received the wrong edition, etc.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Exception Type document includes the Edit Exception Type tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Exception Type tab definition

entry.para: Required. A description or name of the exception type.
Indicates whether this exception type is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate this type.

section.title: Exchange Rate

para.emphasis:
> Exchange Rate
> Exchange Rate Lookup
> Exchange Rate

section.para: Vendors issue invoices in their home currency. Exchange rates are used to convert these currencies into the base currency of the OLE user.

When vendors are set up in OLE the currency type they will use on their invoices is defined in the vendor record. Then when requisitions, purchase orders and invoices are entered, OLE knows what currency is being used and converts the amount to the base currency of the OLE user. OLE uses the Exchange Rate to do this calculation. For example, they are used to convert Euros into United States Dollars.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Exchange Rate document includes the Exchange Rate tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Exchange Rate tab definition

entry.para: Required. The Type of currency being defined.
Required. The exchange rate of the defined currency to the base currency.
The effective date of the Exchange Rate.
Where the exchange rate was obtained.
Indicates whether this exchange rate is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

section.title: Invoice Sub Type Item Reason Added document

> Invoice Sub Type

> Invoice Sub Type Document

para.emphasis: Edit Invoice Type tab definition

A description or name of the invoice subtype.
Indicates whether this invoice subtype is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate this subtype.

section.title: Invoice Type Item Reason Added document

para.emphasis:
> Invoice Type
> Invoice Type Lookup
> Invoice Type Document

section.para: The Invoice Type document identifies the type of invoice on a payment request and may impact workflow.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Invoice Type document includes the Edit Invoice Type tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

A description or name of the invoice type.

section.title: Item Category Carrier document

para.emphasis:
> Category
> Category Lookup
> Category

section.para: The Category document defines the possible groupings used to manage the selection and acquisition of titles on requisitions and purchase orders.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Category document includes the Edit Category tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

Indicates whether this category is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate the code.

section.title: Item Type Item Type document

para.emphasis:
> Item Type
> Item Type Lookup
> Item Type

section.para: The Item Type document defines the different descriptive categories that can be applied to requisition or purchase order line items. Examples might include Item, Service, State Tax, or Shipping and Handling.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The document includes the Edit Item Type tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Item Type tab definition

entry.para: The code to identify this item type.
Required. The familiar title of this item type.
Required. An indicator that the Dollar Total is calculated from the Item quantity times dollar amount rather than a reference to a dollar amount.
Required. Used when additional charges are allowed.
Used when the item is taxable.
Indicates whether this item type code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate this code.

section.title: Method of PO Transmission Method of PO Transmission document

para.emphasis:
> Order Information
>
Method of PO Transmission
> Method of PO Transmission Lookup
> Method of PO Transmission

section.para: The Purchase Order Transmission Method document defines methods for transmitting purchase orders to vendors.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Purchase Order Transmission Method document includes the Edit PO Transmission Method tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit PO Transmission Method tab definition

entry.para: The code to identify this purchase order transmission method.
Required. The familiar title of this purchase order transmission method.
Indicates whether this method of PO transmission code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate this code.

section.title: Note Type

para.emphasis:
> Note Type
> Note Type Lookup
> Note Type Document

section.para: The Note Type document identifies the types of notes, e.g., Receipt Note, Special Conditions Note, or Special Processing Instruction Note that may be associated with Purchasing and Accounts Payable documents.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Note Type document includes the Edit Note Type tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Note Type tab definition

entry.para: Required. A description or name of the note type.
Indicates whether this note type parameter is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

section.title: Order Type

para.emphasis:
> Order Type
> Order Type Lookup
> Order Type

section.para: Order Type identifies the type of order which affects workflow e.g., Firm, Standing, Subscription, etc. Order types were defined primarily to be used for two purposes: (1) to identify POs that would be open indefinitely and against which you would receive and/or pay repeatedly over time (really any order type that was NOT “firm/fixed”); and (2) to allow for different rules to be applied to different order types when defining rules for FY close/rollover.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Order Type document includes the Edit Order Type tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Order Type tab definition

entry.para: Required. A name of the order type.
A description of the order type.
Indicates whether this order type is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

section.title: Payment Method Payment Request Auto Approve Exclusions document

para.emphasis:
> Payment Method
> Payment Method Lookup
> Payment Method Document

section.para: Payment method identifies the method of payment for invoicing e.g., check, cash, wire transfer, etc.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Payment Method document includes the Edit Payment Method tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Payment Method tab definition

entry.para: Required. A name of the payment method.
A description of the payment method.
Indicates whether this payment method is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

section.title: Recurring Payment Type Recurring Payment Type document

para.emphasis:
> Recurring Payment Type
> Recurring Payment Type Lookup
> Recurring Payment Type

section.para: This Recurring Payment Type document defines different types of recurring payments that can be established for a purchase order. Examples might include 'Fixed Schedule, Fixed Payment' or 'Fixed Schedule, Variable Amount.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Recurring Payment Type document includes the Edit Recurring Payment Type tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Recurring Payment Type tab definition

entry.para: The code to identify this recurring payment type.
Required. The description of this recurring payment type.
Indicates whether this recurring payment type code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate this code.

section.title: Request Source Type Requisition Source document

para.emphasis:
> Request Source Type
> Request Source Type Lookup
> Request Source Type

section.para: The Request Source Type document identifies the source of the request e.g., WorldCat, Amazon etc.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Request Source Type document includes the Edit Request Source Type tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Request Source Type tab definition

entry.para: Required. The description or name of this request source type.
Indicates whether this request source type is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

section.title: Sensitive Data Sensitive Data document

para.emphasis:
> Sensitive Data
> Sensitive Data Lookup
> Sensitive Data

section.para: The Sensitive Data document indicates why a Purchase Order document might be restricted from viewing. When a user wants to restrict a document from view because it contains sensitive data, he/she must select a reason why the data is sensitive. After a reason is specified, only authorized staff members may view the document.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Sensitive Data document includes the Edit Sensitive Data tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Sensitive Data tab definition

entry.para: A unique code to identify a particular type of sensitive data.
Required. A description of this type of sensitive data.
Indicates whether this sensitive data code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate this code.

section.title: Electronic Invoice Item Mapping Electronic Invoice Item Mapping document

para.emphasis:
> Electronic Invoice Item Mapping
> Electronic Invoice Item Mapping Lookup
> Electronic Invoice Item Mapping

section.para: The Electronic Invoice Item Mapping document specifies unique mapping of additional items per vendor if the business need exists. OLE follows cXML standards in that five item types are defined (Item, Special Handling, Shipping, and Discount). Each vendor invoice is mapped according to the Electronic Invoice Item Mapping Code table via the electronic invoicing batch job.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Electronic Invoice Item Mapping document includes the Edit Electronic Invoice Item Mapping tab.

para.emphasis: Edit Electronic Invoice Item Mapping tab definition

entry.para: Required. The field name on the vendor invoice to compare the value.

The item code in OLE to which the invoice item type code will map to. Existing item type codes may be retrieved from the lookup
.
Optional. The segment of the vendor number that precedes the dash. For example, for vendor number 1000-0, the vendor header identifier is 1000.
Required if the Vendor Header Identifier field is completed. The segment of the vendor number that follows the dash. For example, for vendor number 1000-0, the detail identifier is 0.

section.title: Format

> Format
> Format Type Lookup
> Format Type

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Format Type document includes the Edit Format Type tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Format Type tab definition

Indicates whether this format type is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate this type.

section.para: The Funding Source document includes the Edit Funding Source tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

Required. The familiar title of this funding source.
Indicates whether this funding source code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate this code.

Indicates whether this item price source is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate this source.

> Item Reason Added
> Item Reason Added Lookup

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Item Reason Added document includes the Edit Reason Added tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Reason Added tab definition

Required. A description of the reason added.
Indicates whether this item reason code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate this code.

section.title: Negative Payment Request Approval Limit Negative Payment Request Approval Limit document

para.emphasis:
> Negative Payment Request Approval Limit
> Negative Payment Request Approval Limit Lookup
> Negative Payment Request Approval Limit

section.para: The Negative Payment Request Approval Limit document identifies an account or organization and specifies a dollar amount limit to exclude the payment request from automated approvals. Payment requests referencing this account or organization and exceeding this dollar amount are excluded from automated approval.

section.title: Document Layout

mediaobject.alt: Negative Payment Request Approval Limit Document

section.para: The Negative Payment Request Approval Limit document includes the Edit Negative PREQ Approval Limit tab.

para.emphasis: Edit Auto Approve Exclude tab definition

entry.para:
Required. The Chart of Accounts code associated with the account to which the dollar limit will apply. Existing chart codes may be retrieved from the lookup
.

The organization code associated with the account to which the dollar limit will apply. Existing organization codes may be retrieved from the lookup
.

The account number to which this dollar limit will apply. Existing account numbers may be retrieved from the lookup
.
Negative Payment Request Approval Limit Amount
Required. The dollar limit above which payment requests will be excluded from automated approval.
Required. Indicates whether this negative payment request approval limit is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

section.title: Organization Parameter Organization Parameter document

para.emphasis:
> Organization APO Limit
> Organization Parameter Lookup

section.para: The Organization Parameter document defines an APO dollar amount limit for a specific organization as identified by a unique combination of chart and organization code.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Organization Parameter document includes the Edit Organization Parameter tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Organization Parameter tab definition

The organization code that identifies the organization for which you want to create an APO limit.
The upper dollar amount that you want this organization to be authorized for on APOs.
Indicates whether this organization parameter is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

section.title: Payment Request Auto Approve Exclusions Payment Request Auto Approve Exclusions document

para.emphasis:
> Payment Request Auto Approve Exclusions
> Payment Request Auto Approve Exclusions Lookup
> Payment Request Auto Approve Exclusions

section.para: Payment requests using specified accounts can be excluded from the automatic approval process which approves an eligible en route document automatically after a specified number of days. The Payment Request Auto Approve Exclusions document identifies the accounts that should be excluded from automated approval.

section.title: Document Layout

mediaobject.alt: Payment Request Auto Approve Exclusions Document

section.para: The Payment Request Auto Approve Exclusions document includes the Edit Auto Approve Exclude tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Auto Approve Exclude tab definition

entry.para: The Chart of Accounts code associated with the account to be excluded.
The account number to be excluded from auto approval.
Indicates whether this payment request auto approval exclusion is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

section.title: Purchase Order Contract Language Purchase Order Contract Language document

para.emphasis:
> Purchase Order Contract Language
> Purchase Order Contract Language Lookup
> Purchase Order Contract Language

section.para: The Purchase Order Contract Language document defines text to be included in purchase order contracts, including printed PDFs. The contract language is defined by campus, allowing variations among campus offices and inclusion of campus-specific language.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Purchase Order Contract Language document includes the Edit PO Contract Language tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit PO Contract Language tab definition

entry.para: Required. The campus code that uses this contract language. Existing campus codes may be retrieved from the list.
Required. Language description associated with this PO contract related to this campus code.
Display only. This field is filled automatically, indicating the date on which this contract language was created in the system.
Indicates whether this purchase order contract language code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate this code.

section.title: Purchase Order Item Status Purchase Order Contract Language document

para.emphasis:
> Purchase Order Item Status
> Order Item Status Lookup
> Order Item Status

section.para: The Purchase Order Item Status identifies the status of individual purchase order items e.g., On order, Received, In process.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Purchase Order Item Status document includes the Edit Order Item Status tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit PO Contract Language tab definition

entry.para: Required. A name of the order item status type.
A description of the order item status type.
Indicates whether this order item status type is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate this type.

section.title: Purchase Order Vendor Choice Purchase Order Vendor Choice document

para.emphasis:
> Purchase Order Vendor Choice

section.para: The Purchase Order Vendor Choice document defines reasons that indicate why a specific vendor was chosen for a purchase.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Purchase Order Vendor Choice document includes the Edit PO Vendor Choice tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit PO Vendor Choice tab definition

Required. The familiar title for the purchase order vendor choice code.
Indicates whether this purchase order vendor choice code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate this code.

section.title: Receiving Address Receiving Address document

para.emphasis:
> Receiving Address
> Receiving Address Lookup
> Receiving Address

section.para: The Receiving Address document defines the possible default receiving addresses for each department.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Receiving Address document includes the Edit Receiving Address tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Receiving Address tab definition

entry.para:
Required. The Chart of Accounts code associated with this organization. Existing chart codes may be retrieved from the lookup
.

Optional. The organization code associated with the receiving address. Existing organization codes may be retrieved from the lookup
.
Required. The familiar title of the receiving address.
Required. The first line of the address information for this receiving address.
Optional. The second line of the address information for this receiving address.
Required. The city name associated with this receiving address.
The state code associated with this receiving address. Existing state codes may be retrieved from the list.
The postal code associated with this receiving address.
Required. The country associated with this receiving address. Existing countries may be retrieved from the list.

Indicates if users are to be allowed to specify the receiving address on requisitions and POs. Clear the box if users are not to be allowed to specify the receiving address (if, for example, all goods are shipped to a central receiving area).
Indicates if this address is to be used as the default receiving address. Clear the check box if it is not.
Indicates whether this receiving address is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

section.title: Receiving Threshold Receiving Threshold document

para.emphasis:
> Receiving Threshold
> Receiving Threshold Lookup
> Receiving Threshold

section.para: The Receiving Threshold document is used to define criteria that determine when an order requires line-item receiving. When an order meets certain criteria and is above a pre-defined dollar limit, the purchase order will not be paid until line item receiving has occurred.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Receiving Threshold document includes the Edit Threshold tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Threshold tab definition

entry.para:
The Chart of Accounts code associated with this receiving threshold. Existing chart codes may be retrieved from the lookup
.

The account type code to be used on this receiving threshold. Existing account type codes may be retrieved from the list or from the lookup
.

The sub fund group code associated with this receiving threshold. Existing sub fund group codes may be retrieved from the lookup
.

The commodity code associated with this receiving threshold. Existing commodity codes may be retrieved from the lookup
.

The object code associated with this receiving threshold. Existing object codes may be retrieved from the lookup
.

The organization code associated with this receiving threshold. Existing organization codes may be retrieved from the lookup
.

The vendor number associated with this receiving threshold. Existing vendor numbers may be retrieved from the lookup
.
Required. The minimum amount that is required to be processed through the receiving process.
Indicates whether this receiving threshold is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

section.title: Recurring Payment Frequency Recurring Payment Frequency document

para.emphasis:
> Recurring Payment Frequency
> Recurring Payment Frequency Lookup
> Recurring Payment Frequency

section.para: The Recurring Payment Frequency document defines payment frequency periods, such as 'annually,' 'monthly,' or 'quarterly.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Recurring Payment Frequency document includes the Edit Recurring Pmt Frequency tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Recurring Pmt Frequency tab definition

entry.para: The code to identify this type of recurring payment frequency.
Required. The familiar title of this recurring payment frequency.
Indicates whether this recurring payment frequency code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate this code.

section.title: Requisition Source Requisition Source document

para.emphasis:
> Requisition Source
> Requisition Source Lookup
> Requisition Source

section.para: This table defines different sources for requisitions that can be imported into the Kuali AP/Purchasing documents.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Requisition Source document includes the Edit Requisition Source tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Requisition Source tab definition

entry.para: The code that identifies this source of requisition information.
Required. The description of this source of requisition.
Indicates whether this requisition source code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate this code.

section.title: Room

para.emphasis:
> Room
> Room Lookup
> Room

section.para: The Room document defines a unique room number within a specific building on a particular campus. The room code is used to identify the room where library materials should be delivered.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Room document includes the Edit Room tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Room tab definition

entry.para: The campus code associated with this room.
The building code associated with this room..
The unique identifier for the room.
The name of the department to which the room is assigned.
A functional description or street address of the building in which the room is located.
Indicates whether this room is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

section.title: Disbursement Voucher Payment Reason

para.emphasis:
> Disbursement Voucher Payment Reason
> Disbursement Voucher Payment Reason Lookup
> Disbursement Voucher Payment Reason

section.para: The Disbursement Voucher Payment Reason document is used to establish the valid payment reasons that may be selected on the Disbursement Voucher document. The payment reason broadly defines the purpose for a particular disbursement. These reasons can be used for the creation of business rules (restricting various attributes on the DV document by payment reason) and for reporting purposes.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Disbursement Voucher Payment Reason document includes the Edit Payment Reason tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Payment Reason tab definition

entry.para: Required. Enter a code that uniquely identifies the payment reason. This value is often referenced when establishing rules related to payment reason.
Required. Enter a name that describes the payment reason. This name appears in the Payment Reason selection box on the DV document.

Required. Enter a text description describing the payment reason and its restrictions. After a payment reason is selected on the DV document you may click question mark
to view the selected payment reason's description.

Indicates whether this payment reason code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate this code. Only active payment reasons appear in the Payment Reasons selection box on the DV document.

section.title: Fiscal Year Function Control

para.emphasis:
> Fiscal Year Function Control
> Fiscal Year Function Control Lookup
> Fiscal Year Function Control

section.para: The Fiscal Year Function Control document defines whether a given Function Control code is active for a specific fiscal year. These values determine whether certain actions related to budgets can be taken in the defined fiscal year.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Fiscal Year Function Control document includes the Edit Fiscal Year Function Control tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Fiscal Year Function Control tab definition

entry.para: The fiscal year for which the function control code is being defined.
The financial system function control code being defined for the fiscal year.
Indicates whether this fiscal year function control code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate this code.

section.title: Function Control Code

para.emphasis:
> Function Control Code
> Function Control Code Lookup
> Function Control Code

section.para: The Function Control document defines the different types of Financial System Function Control codes that may be activated for a given fiscal year on the Fiscal Year Function Control table. Both Function Code and Fiscal Year Function Control relate to budget construction.

para.emphasis: Function Control Code tab definition
BAACTV

entry.para: ndicates if the budget adjustment document is active for a fiscal year

para.emphasis: BASEAD

entry.para: Indicates if base budget adjustments can be performed for a fiscal year

para.emphasis: BCACTV

entry.para: Activates budget construction for a given year

para.emphasis: BCGENE

entry.para: Enables the KFS to accept the budget construction genesis process

para.emphasis: BCUPDT

entry.para: Controls the ability to make updates to budget construction data

para.emphasis: CSFUPD

entry.para: Enables the updating of the calculated salary foundation (CSF)

para.emphasis: PSSYNC

entry.para: Enables OLE to accept synchronization data from the PeopleSoft HR system for budget construction

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Function Control Code document includes the Edit Function Control Code tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Function Control Code tab definition

entry.para: The code that uniquely identifies the function control value.
Selection of this box indicates that the default value is active. Removal of the check in this box deactivates the code.
The text description associated with the function control code.

section.title: Offset Definition

para.emphasis:
> Financial Transaction Controls
>
Offset Definition
> Offset Definition Lookup
> Offset Definition

section.para: The Offset Definition document establishes the types of offset entries that the OLE GL generates for each document type, as part of the batch process. When a generated offset is required, the document type, fiscal year, and chart code of the transaction are matched to these offset definition entries. The offsetting transaction is built using the balance type and object code in the Offset Definition table. The Offset Definition table is used by the Scrubber process.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Offset Definition document includes the Edit Offset Definition tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Offset Definition tab definition

entry.para: The fiscal year for this offset definition.
The chart code applicable to this offset definition.
The document type name applicable to this offset definition.
The balance type code used in the offset entry generated by the OLE GL process.
Required. The object code used in the offsetting entry generated by the OLE GL process. Existing object codes may be retrieved from the lookup

section.title: Organization Reversion

para.emphasis:
> Financial Transaction Controls
>
Organization Reversion
> Organization Reversion Lookup
> Organization Reversion

section.para: The Organization Reversion document defines the reversion/carry forward rules for the year-end process.

The Organization Reversion document comes with a global document option where changes to a group of organizations can be applied at once. This feature of the Global Organization Reversion document is explained in the section after the Organization Reversion document section.

The Organization Reversion Maintenance and Global Organization Reversion documents may be initatied by members of the OLE-SYS Chart Manager role, whereas the Organization Reversion Category document may be initiated by the normal OLE-SYS Manager role.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Organization Reversion document includes the Edit Organization Reversion and Edit Organization Reversion Details tabs The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections. Selected data fields are available for editing.

section.title: Edit Organization Reversion Tab
section.para: The Edit Organization Reversion tab defines two reversion accounts: the budget reversion account and the cash reversion account. The definitions are for specific university organizations as defined within the Chart of Accounts hierarchy and for a specific fiscal year. The accounts are determined by chart code and account number.

mediaobject.alt: Organization Reversion Document: Edit Organization Reversion Tab

para.emphasis: Edit Organization Reversion tab definition

entry.para: The university fiscal year for the designated reversion account
The chart code for this reversion process.
The organization code for this reversion process.

Required. The code that identifies the Chart of Accounts that the budget reversion account belongs to. Existing charts may be retrieved from the lookup
.

tip.para: If accounts cannot cross Charts OLE-SYS ACCOUNTS_CAN_CROSS_CHARTS_IND parameter is set to 'N'), this value is read-only.

entry.para: Required. The account code that identifies the specific account to be used for budget reversions. Existing accounts may be retrieved from the lookup
Required. The code that identifies the Chart of Accounts that the cash reversion account belongs to. Existing charts may be retrieved from the lookup

tip.para: If accounts cannot cross Charts OLE-SYS ACCOUNTS_CAN_CROSS_CHARTS_IND parameter is set to 'N'), this value is read-only.

entry.para: Required. The code that identifies the specific account to be used for cash reversion. Existing accounts may be retrieved from the lookup
Carry Forward by Object Code Indicator
The box is checked when the organization reversion category-defined object code(s) are used for carry forward. Clear the check box when the unallocated object code is used for carry forward.
Indicates whether this org reversion process is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

section.title: Edit Organization Reversion Details Tab
section.para: The Edit Organization Reversion Details tab includes the object codes and carry forward/reversion rules by organization reversion category. Fields indicated as required are only required if that organization reversion category is completed.
This tab must be completed regardless of the carry forward indicator in the Edit Organization Reversion tab.

mediaobject.alt: Organization Reversion Document: Edit Organization Reversion Details Tab

para.emphasis: Edit Organization Reversion tab definition

entry.para: Display-only. Identifies a pre-defined organization reversion category. The categories include 'Org Wages,' 'Salary/Fringes,' 'Financial Aid,' 'Reserve,' 'Transfer Out,' 'Transfer In,' 'Travel,' 'Other Expense,' 'Assess Expend, and Revenue.

Required. The object code to be used in generated carry forward entries by object code when the Carry Forward Object Code Indicator is selected. Existing object codes may be retrieved from the lookup
.
The descriptive name associated with the object code above.
Required. The code that identifies a particular combination of carry forward and reversion rules that may be retrieved from the list (codes are described below).

section.title: Carry Forward Rules
section.para: Each organization reversion code represents a combination of reversion rules (see the table below).

para.emphasis: Organization Reversion Codes

section.para: Also, see the following Carry Forward Rules table for an explanation of each rule. For example, refer to the Rule Code 'xa and xc' to understand which rules apply to the Org Reversion Code 'A.

para.emphasis: Carry Forward Rules

entry.para: Carry forward the budget balance (budget - actual, whether it is positive or negative) in the same account. No budget balances (budget - actual) are reverted to the budget reversion account.
Revert a budget balance (budget - actual - encumbrance, whether it is positive or negative) to the budget reversion account.
Revert the actual cash balance to the cash reversion account.
Do not carry forward budget to cover encumbrances.
Carry forward enough budget to cover encumbrances.
Revert a positive budget balance (budget - actual) to the budget reversion account or carry forward a negative budget balance (budget - actual) to the same account.
Carry forward a positive budget balance (budget - actual) to the same account or revert a negative budget balance (budget - actual) to the budget reversion account.

note.para: The organization reversion categories maintained in the Edit Organization Reversion Details tab are created and deactivated with the Organization Reversion Category Document

tip.para: Selection_ Parameter: Selection_ parameters establish the organization reversion selection rules for the organization reversion step within the GL batch process. These parameters are used in the order identified by the number that comes after SELECTION_ in the parameter name. You may make the rules operate on whatever field of the GL Balance table you want by changing the part of the parameter value that proceeds the '=' sign.

listitem.para: Only members of the OLE-SYS Chart Manager role may initiate the document.

section.title: Organization Reversion Category

para.emphasis:
> Financial Transaction Controls
>
Organization Reversion Category
> Organization Reversion Category Lookup
> Organization Reversion Category

section.para: The Organization Reversion Category document creates new organization reversion categories by assigning them a code, a name, and assigning them a place in the display sequence. Clearing the Active Indicator on this document causes the category to no longer appear on the Edit Organization Details Details tab in the Organization Reversion document. Editing an existing category code could change its name or change its position in the display sequence in the Organization Reversion document.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Organization Reversion Category document includes the Edit Organization Reversion Category tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Organization Reversion Category tab definition

entry.para: The code that identifies the organization reversion category.
Required. The descriptive name associated with a particular organization reversion category code.
Required. The code used to display the organization reversion categories in a particular order in the Edit Organization Reversion Details tab of the Organization Reversion document.
Indicates whether this organization reversion category is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate this organization reversion category.

section.para: The organization reversion categories and the rules are tied by a series of organization reversion business rules stored in the Parameter table. Each organization reversion category is defined for one or more object code attributes.

para.emphasis: Organization Reversion Business Rule Examples

note.para: This is an example of how organization reversion could be implemented in KFS. Each institution must define its own rules.

section.title: Organization Reversion Global

para.emphasis:
> Financial Transaction Controls
>
Organization Reversion Global
> Organization Reversion Global

note.para: For general information about accessing and working with global documents, see Global COA E-Docs.

section.para: The Organization Reversion Global document enables reversion records to be established for multiple organizations simultaneously. Only members of the OLE-SYS Chart Manager role can initiate the Organization Reversion Global document. It routes the same way as the Organization Reversion document.

note.para: The Organization Reversion Global document updates only existing records, just as the Global Account document does. It cannot create new records (as Global Object or Global Sub-Object documents do).

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Organization Reversion Global document includes the Edit Global Organization Reversion Organizations, Edit Global Organization Reversion, and Edit Global Organization Reversion Details tabs. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections. Selected data fields are available for editing.
The Offset Definition document includes the Edit Offset Definition tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections. Selected data fields are available for editing.

section.title: Edit Organization Reversion Tab
section.para:
There are two ways to populate the list of organization codes that you want to change globally. One is by entering or selecting one organization code at a time from the normalOrganization Code lookup
. The other is by using the Look Up / Add Multiple Organization Code Lines
to return multiple values.

mediaobject.alt: Organization Reversion Global Document: Edit Global Organization Reversion Organizations Tab

note.para: For more information about the two types of lookup, see Field Lookup and Multiple Value Lookup on the Guide to OLE Basic Functionality and Key Concepts.

section.title: Edit Global Organization Reversion Tab
section.para: The Edit Global Organization Reversion tab works in the same manner as the Edit Organization Reversion tab of the Organization Reversion document. This tab defines two reversion accounts: the budget reversion account and the cash reversion account. These definitions are for specific university organizations as defined within the Chart of Accounts hierarchy and for a specific fiscal year. The accounts are determined by chart code and account number.

mediaobject.alt: Organization Reversion Global Document: Edit Global Organization Reversion Tab

note.para: For more information about the Edit Global Organization Reversion Tab, see Edit Organization Reversion Tab.

section.title: Edit Global Organization Reversion Details Tab
section.para: The Edit Global Organization Reversion Details tab works in the same manner as the Edit Organization Reversion Details tab of the Organization Reversion document. It contains object codes and carry forward/reversion rules by organization reversion category. Fields indicated as required are required only if that organization reversion category is completed.
This tab must be completed regardless of the Carry Forward Indicator in the Edit Organization Reversion tab.

mediaobject.alt: Organization Reversion Global Document: Edit Global Organization Reversion DetailsTab

note.para: For more information about the Edit GlobalOrganization Reversion DetailsTab, see Edit Organization Reversion DetailsTab.

section.title: Process Overview
section.para: The business rules and routing of the Organization Reversion Global document are identical to those of the Organization Reversion document.
